question: Two similar galvanometers are converted into an ammeter and a milliammeter. The shunt resistance of ammeter as compared to the shunt resistance of milliammeter will be
explanation: Shunt Resistance S = I_g G / (I - I_g).
An ammeter measures larger current (I) compared to a milliammeter.
As current range I increases, the denominator (I - I_g) increases, so S decreases.
Therefore, the ammeter has less shunt resistance.
